SEARCH
Package hw2

Class FuzzballGame

java.lang.Object
hw2.FuzzballGame
public class FuzzballGame extends Object
Models a simplified baseball-like game called Fuzzball.
Author:
Miles Nichols

  • Method Details

    • ball

      public void ball()
      Method called to indicate a bad pitch at which the batter did not swing. This method adds 1 the the batter's count of balls, possibly resulting in a walk. This method does nothing if the game has ended.

    • caughtFly

      public void caughtFly()
      Method called to indicate that the batter is out due to a caught fly. This method does nothing if the game has ended.

    • gameEnded

      public boolean gameEnded()
      Returns true if the game is over, false otherwise. Returns: true if the game is over, false otherwise
      Returns:
      true or false depending on if it is equal to or greater than the maximum number of innings and also not the top of the inning or if it is top of the inning the current inning is more than the maximum number of innings.

    • getBallCount

      public int getBallCount()
      Returns the count of balls for the current batter.
      Returns:
      current number of balls

    • getCalledStrikes

      public int getCalledStrikes()
      Returns the number of called strikes for the current batter.
      Returns:
      current number of strikes

    • getCurrentOuts

      public int getCurrentOuts()
      Returns the number of outs for the team currently at bat.
      Returns:
      current number of outs

    • getTeam0Score

      public int getTeam0Score()
      Returns the score for team 0.
      Returns:
      score for team 0

    • getTeam1Score

      public int getTeam1Score()
      Returns the score for team 1.
      Returns:
      the score for team 1

    • hit

      public void hit(int distance)
      Method called to indicate that the batter hit the ball. The interpretation of the distance parameter is as follows: less than 15: the hit is a foul and the batter is immediately out. at least 15, but less than 150: the hit is a single. An imaginary runner advances to first base, and all other runners on base advance by 1. If there was a runner on third base, the score increases by 1. at least 150, but less than 200: the hit is a double. An imaginary runner advances to second base, and all other runners on base advance by 2. If there were runners on second or third, the score increases by 1 or 2. at least 200, but less than 250: the hit is a triple. An imaginary runner advances to third base, and all other runners on base advance by 3. If there were runners on first, second, or third, the score is increased by 1, 2, or 3. at least 250: the hit is a home run. All imaginary runners currently on base advance to home. The score is increased by 1 plus the number of runners on base. This method does nothing if the game has ended.
      Parameters:
      distance - - the ball travels (possibly negative)

    • isTopOfInning

      public boolean isTopOfInning()
      Returns true if it's the first half of the inning (team 0 is at bat).
      Returns:
      true if it's the first half of the inning, false otherwise

    • runnerOnBase

      public boolean runnerOnBase(int which)
      Returns true if there is a runner on the indicated base, false otherwise. Returns false if the given argument is anything other than 1, 2, or 3.
      Parameters:
      which - - base number to check Returns: true if there is a runner on the indicated base
      Returns:
      the current runner on base

    • strike

      public void strike(boolean swung)
      Method called to indicate a strike for the current batter. If the swung parameter is true, the batter is immediately out. Otherwise, 1 is added to the batters current count of called strikes (possibly resulting in the batter being out). This method does nothing if the game has ended.
      Parameters:
      swung - - true if the batter swung at the pitch, false if it's a "called" strike.

    • whichInning

      public int whichInning()
      Returns the current inning. Innings are numbered starting at 1. When the game is over, this method returns the game's total number of innings, plus one.
      Returns:
      current inning, or the number of innings plus one in case the game is over

    • getBases

      public String getBases()
      Returns a three-character string representing the players on base, in the order first, second, and third, where 'X' indicates a player is present and 'o' indicates no player. For example, the string "oXX" means that there are players on second and third but not on first.
      Returns:
      three-character string showing players on base

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a one-line string representation of the current game state. The format is: 
        ooo Inning:1 [T] Score:0-0 Balls:0 Strikes:0 Outs:0
      The first three characters represent the players on base as returned by the getBases() method. The 'T' after the inning number indicates it's the top of the inning, and a 'B' would indicate the bottom. The score always shows team 0 first.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      a single line string representation of the state of the game
